alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 7:27PM PST until January 18 at 2:15AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. However, this crest is very close to moderate flood stage and the river could briefly oscillate into Moderate Flood Stage this evening. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some farm buildings may be threatened and roads covered in low areas by rising water. Expect widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM PST Monday the stage was 23.0 feet. This is likely the crest. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM PST Monday was 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 23.0 feet Monday evening. It will fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 12/21/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Coquille River Coquille 21.0 23.0 Mon 6 pm PST 20.5 16.7 16.2 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM PST.
